column1: '''Silvan Elvish''' was a name for the tongue spoken by the [[Silvan Elves]].

column2: their language became known as Silvan Elvish
column3: heard both in [[Lothlórien]] and the [[Woodland Realm]] of [[Mirkwood]].

column2: the surviving Elves of [[Beleriand]] carried their speech back into the east. [[Sindarin]]-speakers settled in both the main Silvan realms
column5: Sindarin quickly overtook Silvan Elvish in common use. The history of the tongue in Mirkwood is more difficult to determine - some sources suggest that it

column1: By the end of the [[Third Age]]
column2: the only remnants of Silvan were a few names
column5: but actually betray the influences of Silvan words.

column1: In one note [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] calls the language just Silvan.<ref>{{MR|P3I5}}
